IMesh.h

Defines interface for mesh.

CFaceVertex
struct
CFaceVertex

Defines a vertex data relative to a given face.  See CGeomVertex for further information.

CHalfEdge
CHalfEdge

Defines a single half edge on our graph

Members
m_pNext

Next half edge in edge loop

m_pPrev

Previous half edge in edge loop

m_pOpposite

Opposite half edge

m_pVertex

Vertex at head of edge

m_pFace

Face to the left of edge

m_smoothingGroup

Smoothing group this edge belongs to index -

Functions
GetNextEdge
CHalfEdge* GetNextEdge()

Returns the next edge in our edge loop

GetPrevEdge
CHalfEdge *GetPrevEdge()

Returns the previous edge in our edge loop

GetOppositeEdge
CHalfEdge *GetOppositeEdge()

Returns the half edge opposite to the current edge

GetHeadVertex
CGeomVertex* GetHeadVertex()

Returns the vertex at the head of this edge

GetTailVertex
CGeomVertex* GetTailVertex()

Returns the vertex at the tail of this edge

GetFace
CFace *GetFace()

Returns the face this edge is a boundary of

Returns

Pointer to the current face

GetSmoothingGroup
uint32_t GetSmoothingGroup()

Returns the smoothing group this edge belongs to

Returns

ID of the smoothing group this edge belongs to

CFace
CFace

Defines a face in our CMesh

Functions
GetNormal
Vector3 GetNormal()

Returns the normal vector for a face

GetCenter
Vector3 GetCenter()

Returns the center point for a face

GetEdge
CHalfEdge *GetEdge()

Returns a pointer to once of the edges in the edge loop that makes up the face.

GetNumberVertices
uint32_t GetNumberVertices()

Returns the number of vertices in the face.

CGeomVertex *GetVertex(
uint32_t 
idx
)

Returns the Nth vertex in a face

Parameters
idx
uint32_t

index of vertex

ComputeFaceNormal
void ComputeFaceNormal()

Computes the normal for the face using Newell's method

IsDegenerate
bool IsDegenerate()

Returns true if the face is degenerate. Otherwise, returns false.

Types
EVertexFlags

Define flags describing what fields are available in a SVertex

ETriangulateMethod

Defines the method used for converting a polygonal mesh into a trianglar mesh.

EMeshFlags
enum
EMeshFlags

Defines various flags associated with an ISubMesh

TwoSided

Mesh is considered to be two sided

ISubMesh

ISubMesh is used by clients for manipulating a submesh. A submesh contains actual mesh data. This is different from a mesh object which is just a collection of submesh objects.

Functions

Ray3& 
ray,
RayIntersect3* 
pIntersection,
uint32_t* 
pMaterialID
) = 0

Computes the intersection between a ray and a mesh.

Returns

&
bbox
) = 0

Rescales a mesh so fits inside a -0.5..+0.5 bounding box

Parameters
bbox
const BBox3&

Bounding box of the mesh

ComputeNormals
virtual void ComputeNormals() = 0

This method will compute all the vertex normals on the mesh by summing and normalizing the face vertices around each vertex (via Newell's method). NOTE: This makes an implicit assumption that each face is planar. This is not always the case and can thus result in incorrect normals (for instance, the faces from CreateSphere() will not be planar).  To prevent incorrect normals, it is first recommended that the mesh be triangulated first via CSubMesh::Triangulate().

*
pVertex
) = 0

ToMeshData
virtual MeshData ToMeshData(
ID3D11Device* 
pDevice,

vector<D3D11_INPUT_ELEMENT_DESC>& 
vertexLayout,
uint32_t 
vertexSize
) = 0

Parameters

device

vertexLayout
std::vector<D3D11_INPUT_ELEMENT_DESC>&

description of each vertex's layout

vertexSize
uint32_t

size of each vertex in bytes

Returns

Returns renderable form of the mesh

IMesh

IMesh is simply a collection of submesh objects (ISubMesh).

NOTE: This mesh is different from a renderable mesh. There is a function MeshToD3D which will convert the mesh into a renderable mesh.
